modules.description: Draws shapes like lines, circles, and rectangles using a coordinate-based system, and handles color manipulation and pixel-level rendering. It operates on window contexts, graphical coordinates, and RGB color values. Used for creating interactive visualizations, simple games, and real-time data displays.

Returns the unique identifier of an OCaml graphics window as a decimal string, creates sub-windows with specified dimensions, and closes existing sub-windows using their identifiers. Operates on window identifiers represented as strings and integer coordinates/size values. Used to manage multiple layered graphical elements within a single windowed application.

The module provides window management, 2D vector-based drawing, and event-driven interaction through integer coordinates, colors, and geometric primitives, enabling precise control over graphical elements like lines, shapes, and text. It supports rendering operations, image handling, and display synchronization, working with data structures such as coordinates, color values, and event states to facilitate applications like game development or data visualization. Specific use cases include creating interactive interfaces, generating vector graphics, and managing real-time user input.
